org.gicentre.geomap

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gicentre.geomap.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Feature

    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements Feature
    Class for representing and drawing a line feature.
    Version:
    1.3, 4th March, 2017.
    Author:
    Jo Wood , giCentre, City University of London.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(float[] x, float[] y, processing.core.PApplet parent)
      Constructs a new line object with the given geometry.

      • setRenderer

        public void setRenderer(Drawable renderer)
        Sets the renderer to be used for drawing this feature. This need only be set if some non-default rendering is required (such as the sketchy rendering produced by the Handy library).
        Specified by:
        setRenderer in interface Feature
        Parameters:
        renderer - New renderer to use or null if default rendering is to be used.

      • setTolerance

        public static void setTolerance(float tolerance)
        Sets the tolerance values used for contains() testing. Any location within a distance of the given tolerance of this line is considered to be contained within it. Note that this method is static, meaning that a single tolerance value is shared by all line objects.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - Tolerance distance in the same units as the line's coordinates.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(float px,
                        float py)
        Tests whether the given point is located somewhere along the line feature. Coordinates should be in the same geographic units as the line.
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Feature
        Parameters:
        px - x coordinate in geographic coordinates.
        py - y coordinate in geographic coordinates.
        Returns:
        True if the given point is located along the line feature, false if not.
